item.title: Tidyverse: Getting Your Feet Wet
item.description:
Workflow Resources Up Front tibble %>% Sample Data “Tidy” Data {dplyr} select() columns ggplot() Exercise 1 filter() Rows ggplot() Exercise 2 mutate() Columns ggplot() Exercise 3 arrange() Rows group_by() for Grouped Data ggplot() Exercise 4 summarize() ggplot() Exercise 5 Reflection Image credit to R Memes for Statistical Fiends
I recently had the opportunity to teach some tidyverse code to colleagues and classmates in a series of workshops.

item.title: My Shiny Apps
item.description: recon : Really Convenient Spatial Data Search for locations by class or with a fuzzy name matching gazetteer. Deep Learning Image Classifier TensorFlow-powered image classification. North Korea Threat Finance Explorer A tool to facilitate access to DPRK sanctions data.

item.title: GDELT, Missiles, and Image Collection
item.description: -- -- The Global Database of Events, Language, and Tone, or GDELT, is “a realtime network diagram and database of global human society for open research”. The potential for a firehose stream of global data has tantalizing possibilities for research, but concrete examples of work beyond simple evaluations of the database’s capabilities are notably absent… See also: My hasty walkthrough from November 2017, Evaluating GDELT: Syrian Conflict Let’s see how well we can scoop up a set of ballistic missile images using a combination of packages:

item.title: Welcome
item.description: body .main-container { max-width: 700px; } Hi, I’m Brendan. I’m interested in developing the data-driven insights required to fully enable decision makers. Topically, my primarily focus is national security issues, but considering the wildly interdisciplinary nature of such work, I am constantly exploring other fields. In the past, I worked as a security manager, combat medic, noncommissioned officer, linguist, and herder of cats. When I finally returned to formal academia, I developed a love for data analysis and programming.
